In three sentences
Comments
A very safe place to be
There are no fraternities or sororities on campus but the dorms are separated by genders.
There are many clubs and outreach groups that can help shape our community and the surrounding Nampa area.
-Christian -Anyone who is wanting to be part of a family
The college is expensive but overall, it is worth it. I feel so privleged to go to school here because it is a very safe and loving place.
There is always something going on on campus and when in doubt, there are always people looking to do something fun but safe.
There is a variety of options for eating. Sometimes the meals are repetitive but overall the food is usually fresh.
As a freshman not knowing anyone when I came to NNU, I was very nervous but dorm life is the best. It is an incredible opportunity to meet a lot of amazing girls.
I am always pushed to do my best and I am challenged in my studies. In the end though my professors help me and care. It is very rewarding.
I would strongly recommend NNU for college. There are many caring people and teachers.
Northwest Nazarene University is a place where everyone fits in and feels welcome. We are all a community and there is always support here. School is a challenge but very rewarding!

textAfterTable: Am learning a lot This University has an excellent student to teacher ratio. There are many classes that have 30 or less and when it comes down to my specific major, the class sizes are even smaller. This is helpful when needing help or if I have questions on the material. I can call most of my professors at anytime and schedule an appointment if I need to and all the faculty and staff are very friendly. Login to rate or flag the reviews Suzie Student 11/03/2012 Reviewer is A current student here. 2 out of 2 people found this review useful. 3 of 35 Categories Comments Campus Safety The campus is well lite at night. There is when security needed. I feel very safe on campus even when I am there at night. Clubs and Activities There are a variety of clubs and activites for students to join and be a part
